definition: unable to say
to persuade
to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)
(negative prefix)/not/no

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
having unspeakable bitter suffering/(often used after 啞巴吃黃連|哑巴吃黄连[ya3 ba5 chi1 huang2 lian2])
to be forced to suffer in silence (idiom)/unable to speak of one's bitter suffering/sometimes written 啞子吃黃連，有苦說不出|哑子吃黄连，有苦说不出
pinyin: ya3 ba5 chi1 huang2 lian2 , you3 ku3 shuo1 bu5 chu1
containing_words.word: 啞巴吃黃連，有苦說不出

definition: speechless

sentences.english: On my first day of school, I didn't speak a word of English.
sentences.chinese: 當我第一天上學時，我連一個英文單詞都說不出口。

sentences.english: In the process, what must be spoken meets what cannot be said.
sentences.chinese: 其間，非說不可的遇到了說不出來的。

sentences.english: But the little squirrel too tired to say a word.
sentences.chinese: 可是小松鼠累得說不出一句話來了。

sentences.english: Cora tried to speak, but the words wouldn't come out.
sentences.chinese: 柯拉想要說話，但是話說不出來。

sentences.english: Why did she have the kind of unspeakable loneliness?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼她會有那種說不出的孤寂感？

sentences.english: The who was mute with shock was Safiyah, the other one was her cousin.
sentences.chinese: 害怕的說不出話的是索菲婭，另一個是她的表姐妹。

sentences.english: He tried to say something, butgulp, and no word come.
sentences.chinese: 他想說什麼，但哽住了，什麼話都說不出來。

sentences.english: That is one of the unsayable truths of our time.
sentences.chinese: 這就是我們這個時代說不出口的事實。

sentences.english: She was too angry to say a word.
sentences.chinese: 她太生氣了以致於說不出一句話。

sentences.english: Jill was so shocked by the bad news that she couldn't say a single word.
sentences.chinese: 傑爾聽到這個壞消息震驚得一個字都說不出來。

sentences.english: I suddenly felt very worried, but could not say anything.
sentences.chinese: 我突然非常着急起來，但卻什麼也說不出來。

sentences.english: Groanings which cannot be uttered are often prayers which cannot be refused.
sentences.chinese: 說不出來的嘆息，常是不能拒絕的禱告。

sentences.english: I can’t tell what will happen.
sentences.chinese: 我可說不出將會發生什麼事。

sentences.english: Listening to sad songs, singing is not for me to say the mood.
sentences.chinese: 聽着憂傷的歌，唱的全是我說不出的心情。

sentences.english: Too proud of me to speak!
sentences.chinese: 過於爲我“驕傲”而說不出話。

sentences.english: She was silent, and I guessed at her unutterable depression.
sentences.chinese: 她不說話了，但我猜她有滿腔說不出的鬱悶。

definition: to have guts/to have courage/to be brave
to feel/to become aware of/feeling/sense/perception/CL:個|个[ge4]
helpless/without choice/for lack of better option/grudgingly/willy-nilly/nolens volens/abbr. for 無可奈何|无可奈何[wu2 ke3 nai4 he2]
lit. that person/fig. the person you have been looking for/Mr Right/the girl of one's dreams
incomparable/matchless
to feel unwell/to suffer pain/to be difficult to bear
a modal particle indicating (don't mind it, ok)
a modal particle indicating (that's all, only, nothing much)
chest/heart/mind
always
vague/faint/indistinct
that's right/sure!/rest assured!/that's good/can't go wrong
to feel/to sense/to detect/to perceive/to become aware
sad/sorrowful
for a long time/for ages
to mix together (disparate substances)/to mingle/a mix/to be tangled up with
to speak out/to declare (one's view)
